page.title: 05SLOUGH TODAY
page.content: "Come friendly bombs and fall on Slough" says Sir John Betjeman's famous poem.Very few bombs fell on Slough and it is still much as he saw it.People in Slough think the poem unfair. There are plenty of fields, parks and green places,like Upton Park and Herschel Park.There isn't much pollution now as the factories are modern and use electricity. But people agree that the streets are crowded and depressing.There are many shops and a shopping precinct .The centre of the High Street has been re-paved and made traffic free and the precinct is being refurbished.This should make it a lot more pleasant. The traffic through the town is not so heavy now the M4 motorway has opened.
